decks.notes: This control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress, while also controlling the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Maelstrom Pulse. The deck also utilizes mana acceleration with Llanowar Elves and Mutavault, and has a strong late-game with creatures like Ouroboroid and Badgermole Cub. The inclusion of cards like Culling Ritual and Tear Asunder allows for additional disruption and removal. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through hand disruption, removal, and powerful creatures.

The deck focuses on using efficient creatures and disruption spells to control the board while generating mana through land and creature abilities. The key strategy is to assemble a combo involving Sentinel of the Nameless City, Badgermole Cub, and Ouroboroid to create a powerful synergy that overwhelms the opponent. By using a mix of removal, hand disruption, and ramp, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and combo off for a decisive victory.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on casting cheap spells to trigger prowess abilities on creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, dealing damage quickly and efficiently. It also includes cards like Pyroclasm and Fiery Impulse to control the board and remove threats from the opponent. The deck aims to be aggressive and fast-paced, using a combination of burn spells and aggressive creatures to overwhelm the opponent and win the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent by playing low-cost, aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, while also using burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage to control the board and finish off opponents. The deck also includes card draw and manipulation with spells like Academic Dispute and Consider to keep the pressure up and maintain card advantage. The mana base is designed to support both red and blue spells, allowing for flexibility in casting spells and maintaining tempo throughout the game.

The main strategy of this aggro Red Deck Wins Pioneer 1 vs 1 deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Sunspine Lynx, supported by burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Soul-Scar Mage and Kumano Faces Kakkazan, while also utilizing lands like Den of the Bugbear and Ramunap Ruins for extra damage. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and powerful attacks to secure victory.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on efficiently ramping up mana with cards like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, while disrupting opponents' strategies with creatures like Archon of Emeria and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben. Collected Company allows for explosive plays, while Skyclave Apparition deals with problematic threats. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a mix of aggressive creatures and disruption, utilizing cards like Badgermole Cub and Ouroboroid to maintain board presence. The inclusion of Elspeth, Storm Slayer provides additional late-game reach and finishing power.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with quick and aggressive creatures and spells. The deck focuses on dealing damage quickly and efficiently, using cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage to chip away at the opponent's life total. The deck also includes various burn spells like Fiery Impulse and Pyroclasm to clear the way for attacks. Additionally, the deck utilizes card draw and selection spells like Consider and Academic Dispute to maintain momentum and find the resources needed to win the game.

This UW Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy and maintaining control of the game through a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by utilizing cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Memory Deluge to generate card advantage and control the board with cards like Supreme Verdict and Get Lost. The inclusion of Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion adds another threat to the deck and provides additional synergy with the deck's creature package.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix, while using cheap removal and card draw to control the board. It also utilizes cards like Treasure Cruise and Consider to dig deeper into the deck for key pieces. The inclusion of Picklock Prankster adds extra pressure and disruption to the opponent, making it difficult for them to stabilize. Overall, the deck aims to be fast and aggressive, punishing slow starts and out-tempoing the opponent to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing creatures with aggressive abilities to overwhelm the opponent quickly. It also includes cards that provide additional value and protection for your creatures. The deck aims to maintain a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Skyclave Apparition and Extraction Specialist. With a mix of efficient creatures and versatile spells, this deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain that momentum throughout the game.

The main concept of this deck is to play aggressively, using cards like Monastery Swiftspear, Cori-Steel Cutter, and Emberheart Challenger to deal damage quickly to the opponent. The deck also includes spells like Reckless Rage and Burst Lightning to control the board and clear the way for your creatures. The mana base is optimized to support an aggressive playstyle, with plenty of Mountains and dual lands like Spirebluff Canal and Steam Vents. Overall, the deck focuses on applying pressure early and maintaining that pressure throughout the game.

The main concept of the deck is to create a fast and aggressive board presence using cheap creatures and mana ramp, along with disruptive elements like Thalia to hinder the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to utilize cards like Collected Company and Skyclave Apparition to maintain pressure and control the board, while also using powerful threats like Archon of Emeria and Elspeth, Storm's Slayer to close out the game quickly. The mana base is focused on producing the necessary colors for the deck and providing consistent access to mana sources.

This red aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with early creature threats like Monastery Swiftspear and Emberheart Challenger, supported by burn spells like Burst Lightning and Ramunap Ruins. Den of the Bugbear and Sokenzan, Crucible of Defiance provide additional creature threats. Monstrous Rage and Reckless Rage help pump up your creatures for extra damage, while Soul-Scar Mage and Screaming Nemesis help control the board. Academic Dispute and Cori-Steel Cutter provide card advantage and disruption, allowing you to maintain pressure and close out the game swiftly.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using low-cost spells and creatures. By utilizing cards like Burst Lightning, Reckless Rage, and Emberheart Challenger, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and finish the game as fast as possible. The deck also includes cards like Academic Dispute and Stormchaser's Talent to maintain card advantage and support the aggressive strategy. The key focus is on creating a fast-paced and efficient offense that puts pressure on the opponent from the beginning of the game.

This UR Aggro deck is focused on quickly deploying creatures like Cori-Steel Cutter, Emberheart Challenger, and Monastery Swiftspear to deal damage to the opponent. Spells like Reckless Rage and Fiery Impulse help remove blockers and control the board. The deck also includes cards like Academic Dispute and Experimental Synthesizer to generate card advantage and keep the pressure on the opponent. With a mix of burn spells and aggressive creatures, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient threats and close out the game before they can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing cards that allow for card draw, bouncing opponent's permanents, and countering spells. The deck aims to maintain a strong board presence through cards like Cori-Steel Cutter and Gran-Gran, while also having options for removal with Combustion Technique and Torch the Tower. The mana base is built to support the deck's color requirements and allow for flexibility in casting spells. It aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents through careful resource management and strategic decision-making.
